Topic.Title: No need for x86

Message.Msg: I'm not a big fan of ARMH as a long-term purchase either but I never have considered shorting it. If you look at just the P/E ratio, it does make you wonder when it will pullback significantly, not short-term apparently :). There are certain stocks that defy any fundamental logic, just look at NFLX and the P/E ratio, over 400!!! It was over 500 before their earnings report. I know the business models are very different, but still . . If I had either NFLX or ARMH before the latest earnings and held, I'd certainly consider selling now, at least half of the holdings. Looking forward to having that problem with NVDA :).

Message.Title: Many people I know simply do not trust the market
Message.Msg: and you really can't blame them. A fake twitter takes out all the stop losses and reacts too fast for ordinary people to cover or trade. We have no enforcement of naked shorting and we got rid of the uptick rule because a few members of Congress got bought off. Hedge funds are created to take advantage of the system's weakness. They are not, IMO, simple investment clubs. They are designed to swindle and our congress has helped. You know something is amiss when a new Representative without any wealth to speak of becomes a mufti-millionaire within two years. Our Congress is, IMO, paid for lock stock and barrel. Treat the market as something that wants to hurt you and you will be better off. Too bad we have so many crooks in this country. JMHO

Topic.Title: Seeking Alpha article on NVIIDA - not by those two

Message.Msg: "you know as well as I that I understand this company and its technology, prospects, etc. far better than many." better? Better is up for debate. I'm not defending anyone here, but I don't think you understand this company as well as many others here. Many of the brightest simply lurk and do not regularly post. Kivmax is an example, schmenkle too. I would not group you into the set of the sharpest pencils in the drawer, you are simply a pencil looking for an opportunity. Then you will be gone. Trader. That would be a more apt description. You may see an opportunity, but truthfully your timing hasn't been great. Opportunist would also work. Investing. That is where the play with NVDA is. Ibexx fits better into that description than you do. Investor. Neither a speculator (who takes on high risks for high rewards) nor a gambler (who takes on the risk of total loss for out of proportion rewards) but one whose primary objectives are preservation of the original investment (the principal), a steady income, and capital appreciation.

Message.Title: Some key points from AAPL earnings cc....
Message.Msg: --FYQ2 (ending March, 2013): both eps and rev beat for FYQ3 (current Q), both eps and rev will miss substantially. --Capital allocation (cash return to investors): $30 billions. This would've been the entire tax-free cash flow for FY2012. Apple will issue debt to partially finance this. S&P already assigns AA+ rating. --Tim Cook said, "Our growth has slowed." --Iphone channel inventory has increased from 1 million to 11 millions; ipad inventory increased from 1.4 millions to 4.8 millions. Relatively stagnant by historical Apple standard. --In FYQ2, more ipad mini were sold than new ipad, thus margins were negatively impacted, In the case of iPhone, as many old models were sold as iphone 5. --China market not taking off --Last, but not the least important: TC indicated that new Apple products will be introduced in the fall and into the holiday season. Major investors/analysts had hope that there would be summer refreshes of iphone and/or ipads, but NOPE. Apple will likely be in a trading range for the next 5-6 months, during which the market may register new lows for AAPL.

Message.Title: HTC & Nvidia Tegra!
Message.Msg: Tegra is great. Tegra is best right? Then why did HTC ran away from tegra? After the first HTC one X, they ran far away. No new HTC phones run on tegra. New HTC one, Butterfly etc. U know why? I am using the tegra HTC one X. Just surfing net and typing on the message board can make phone heat up. When it gets hot, things slow down, cant even type properly as things slow down. Nvidia tried to be smart. You know marketing 101? Product differentiation? Only problem is Nvidia went too far. They design product that is beyond human race. Humans dun want. They designed them for aliens! Bloody Nvidia.
